text:
Does anyone know of any code snippets showing how to read from a file into a `struct` with an `Array` member like
```struct Foo
a::Float64
b::Array{Int64, 5}
c::Int64
end```
I've tried a few combinations of nested `(read(), read()...)` but end up with some form of `ERROR: The IO stream does not support reading objects of type Array{Int64,5}` .

Yes, I tried that but what I am confused about is how I am supposed to be structuring my `read` calls. I have been trying various forms of

```function Base.read(io::IO, t::Type{Foo})
    Foo(read(io, Float64), read(io, Array{Int32}), read(io, Int64), 
end```

text:
I was working wayyy too hard at this:man-facepalming:. 1. I was reading the wrong file, and all I needed to do was wrap it in an Array constructor like:

Foo(...Int32[read(io, Int32), read(io, Int32), read(io, Int32)]...
